entries.name: must_C_versionclick to toggle source
entries.desc: This method is defined for backward compatibility.

entries.name: new(string, fixed_anchor: false)click to toggle source
<<(str)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Appends str to the string being scanned. This method does not affect scan pointer.

entries.name: [](n)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the n-th subgroup in the most recent match.

entries.name: beginning_of_line?()
entries.desc: Returns true iff the scan pointer is at the beginning of the line.

entries.name: capturesclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns the subgroups in the most recent match (not including the full match). If nothing was priorly matched, it returns nil.

entries.name: charpos()
entries.desc: Returns the character position of the scan pointer.  In the 'reset' position, this value is zero.  In the 'terminated' position (i.e. the string is exhausted), this value is the size of the string.

entries.name: check(pattern)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This returns the value that scan would return, without advancing the scan pointer.  The match register is affected, though.

entries.name: check_until(pattern)click to toggle source
entries.desc: This returns the value that scan_until would return, without advancing the scan pointer.  The match register is affected, though.

entries.name: clear()
entries.desc: Equivalent to terminate. This method is obsolete; use terminate instead.

entries.name: concat(str)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Appends str to the string being scanned. This method does not affect scan pointer.

entries.name: empty?()
entries.desc: Equivalent to eos?. This method is obsolete, use eos? instead.

entries.name: eos?()
entries.desc: Returns true if the scan pointer is at the end of the string.

entries.name: exist?(pattern)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Looks ahead to see if the pattern exists anywhere in the string, without advancing the scan pointer.  This predicates whether a scan_until will return a value.

entries.name: fixed_anchor? → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Whether scanner uses fixed anchor mode or not.

entries.name: get_byte()
entries.desc: Scans one byte and returns it. This method is not multibyte character sensitive. See also: getch.

entries.name: getbyte()
entries.desc: Equivalent to get_byte. This method is obsolete; use get_byte instead.

entries.name: getch()
entries.desc: Scans one character and returns it. This method is multibyte character sensitive.

entries.name: inspect()
entries.desc: Returns a string that represents the StringScanner object, showing:

entries.name: match?(pattern)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Tests whether the given pattern is matched from the current scan pointer. Returns the length of the match, or nil.  The scan pointer is not advanced.

entries.name: matched()
entries.desc: Returns the last matched string.

entries.name: matched?()
entries.desc: Returns true iff the last match was successful.

entries.name: matched_size()
entries.desc: Returns the size of the most recent match (see matched), or nil if there was no recent match.

entries.name: peek(len)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Extracts a string corresponding to string[pos,len], without advancing the scan pointer.

entries.name: peep(p1)
entries.desc: Equivalent to peek. This method is obsolete; use peek instead.

entries.name: pointer()
entries.desc: Returns the byte position of the scan pointer.  In the 'reset' position, this value is zero.  In the 'terminated' position (i.e. the string is exhausted), this value is the bytesize of the string.

entries.name: pos=(n)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the byte position of the scan pointer.

entries.name: pos()
entries.desc: Returns the byte position of the scan pointer.  In the 'reset' position, this value is zero.  In the 'terminated' position (i.e. the string is exhausted), this value is the bytesize of the string.

entries.name: pos=(n)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Sets the byte position of the scan pointer.

entries.name: post_match()
entries.desc: Returns the post-match
